requirement_tested: A team introduction section displaying team members and their roles
user_persona: A visitor interested in learning about the team behind the projects.
user_goal: To view the team members, their roles, and read more about them by interacting with their cards.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on the Team Section
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scrolls down to the 'Meet Our Team' section and sees a row of team member cards.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the team section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multiple cards are displayed horizontally, each showing a circular avatar, name, role, and short bio excerpt in dark cyan text on a whitesmoke background.

narrative_steps.title: Hovering Over a Card
narrative_steps.description: Curious about a particular member, Sarah hovers her mouse over a card to see if anything changes.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a team member card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The card's shadow intensifies and the card slightly scales up.

narrative_steps.title: Clicking a Team Member Card
narrative_steps.description: Intrigued, Sarah clicks on a team member's card to learn more about them.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a team member card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The card expands to reveal the full biography and social media links of the selected team member.

requirement_tested: A project showcase section listing team projects with descriptions and visuals
user_persona: A potential client browsing the portfolio to assess the team's capabilities.
user_goal: To explore various projects showcased by the team and view detailed information about one of interest.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Project Showcase
narrative_steps.description: John navigates to the 'Our Projects' section where he finds a grid of project cards.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the project showcase section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid layout displays project cards with cover images, titles, short descriptions, and technology tags, styled with dark cyan text on a whitesmoke background.

narrative_steps.title: Hovering Over a Project Card
narrative_steps.description: John hovers his cursor over a project card to see how it responds.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a project card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The cover image zooms in slightly and the project title becomes highlighted.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Project for Details
narrative_steps.description: Interested in a specific project, John clicks on the card to view more in-depth details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a project card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: John is redirected to a dedicated project detail page featuring an expanded view with gallery images, full description, and tech stack breakdown.

requirement_tested: A skill showcase section highlighting the team's technical and soft skills
user_persona: A hiring manager evaluating the competencies of the team.
user_goal: To review the team's skills and understand their proficiency levels.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Skill Showcase
narrative_steps.description: Emma scrolls to the 'Skills' section and observes two subsections: Technical and Soft Skills.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the skills section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Two clearly labeled subsections appear, each listing horizontal bar charts representing different skills, styled with dark cyan bars on a whitesmoke background.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Skill Proficiency
narrative_steps.description: Emma moves her cursor over one of the skill bars to get more context.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a skill bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip appears showing additional context about how that skill has been applied by the team.

requirement_tested: A contact information section providing ways to reach the team
user_persona: A visitor wanting to get in touch with the team for collaboration.
user_goal: To find and use available contact methods to connect with the team.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Contact Information
narrative_steps.description: Mike reaches the 'Get In Touch' section and sees a list of contact options.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the contact section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Icons and labels for email, phone, address, and social media are displayed vertically with dark cyan text on a whitesmoke background.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Contact
narrative_steps.description: Mike decides to connect via email and clicks the corresponding link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the email link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The default email client opens with a new message addressed to the team.

requirement_tested: Frontend pages to display team data fetched dynamically from backend APIs
user_persona: A developer checking if the frontend properly loads and displays dynamic data.
user_goal: To verify that the frontend retrieves and renders team data correctly after loading.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Load
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the homepage and waits for content to load.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loading spinners appear initially in each section before being replaced with actual data once fetched from backend APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Handling API Failure
narrative_steps.description: Alex simulates an API failure to observe error handling behavior.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate API failure during data fetch.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A user-friendly error message is displayed within the affected section without breaking the overall UI flow.

requirement_tested: Backend API endpoints to serve team, project, and skill data from a PostgreSQL database
user_persona: A tester validating that the backend serves correct data.
user_goal: To ensure backend endpoints return accurate data from the database.

narrative_steps.title: Requesting Team Data
narrative_steps.description: Tester sends a GET request to the team members endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to '/api/team-members'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server returns a JSON response with a list of team members retrieved from the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Requesting Project Data
narrative_steps.description: Tester sends another GET request to fetch project data.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to '/api/projects'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server responds with project data in JSON format sourced from the 'projects' table in PostgreSQL.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting storage of team members, projects, skills, and contact details
user_persona: A database administrator verifying schema integrity.
user_goal: To confirm that all required tables exist with proper structures.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: DBA connects to the PostgreSQL database and inspects existing tables.
narrative_steps.action: Connect to PostgreSQL and query for tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Four tables—team_members, projects, skills, and contact_info—are found with defined columns and constraints matching the schema specification.

requirement_tested: Environment configuration for PostgreSQL connection using specified DB credentials
user_persona: A DevOps engineer deploying the application.
user_goal: To ensure the backend connects securely to the PostgreSQL database using environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Environment Configuration
narrative_steps.description: DevOps engineer checks the .env file at the root of the project.
narrative_steps.action: Open and inspect the .env file.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The file contains the exact environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Backend Connection
narrative_steps.description: Engineer starts the backend service to verify successful database connection.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend logs indicate successful connection to the PostgreSQL database using the credentials from the .env file.

requirement_tested: Frontend styled with a default background color of whitesmoke and component color of dark cyan
user_persona: A designer reviewing the visual consistency of the site.
user_goal: To confirm that the site adheres to the specified color scheme throughout.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Styles
narrative_steps.description: Designer opens the homepage and inspects the base styling.
narrative_steps.action: Check the global CSS or style settings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The background color is set to whitesmoke (#F5F5F5) and component text/icons use dark cyan (#008B8B).

requirement_tested: Navigation menu allowing users to access each main section of the site
user_persona: A first-time visitor exploring the website structure.
user_goal: To easily navigate between different sections of the site using the menu.

narrative_steps.title: Using Navigation Menu
narrative_steps.description: Anna sees the fixed navigation bar at the top and wants to go to the Projects section.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Projects' link in the navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page smoothly scrolls to the anchor element associated with the 'Projects' section.

requirement_tested: Responsive design ensuring usability across desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the website on a smartphone.
user_goal: To have a seamless experience while navigating the site on a small screen.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: User resizes the browser window to simulate a mobile screen size.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to below 768px width.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts responsively: navigation collapses into a hamburger menu, grids stack vertically, and fonts resize appropriately.

requirement_tested: Project case view allowing detailed exploration of individual projects
user_persona: A stakeholder interested in the specifics of a past project.
user_goal: To view detailed information and media related to a specific project.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Project Detail Page
narrative_steps.description: User navigates to a project detail page and views the gallery.
narrative_steps.action: Go to a project detail page and click on a thumbnail.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Featured image updates dynamically to show the selected gallery image without reloading the page.

requirement_tested: Contact form enabling visitors to send messages directly to the team
user_persona: A prospective collaborator reaching out to the team.
user_goal: To submit a message through the contact form and receive confirmation.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Out Contact Form
narrative_steps.description: Visitor fills out the contact form with their details and message.
narrative_steps.action: Enter name, email, and message into the contact form fields and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: If valid, a success alert is shown; otherwise, invalid fields are highlighted for correction.

requirement_tested: Package.json scripts for `install:all` to set up both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To quickly install all necessary dependencies for both frontend and backend.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Developer clones the repository and runs the install script.
narrative_steps.action: Execute `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json script for `dev` to run frontend and backend servers concurrently
user_persona: A developer beginning work on the project.
user_goal: To start both development servers with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer wants to launch both frontend and backend services for local development.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend servers start concurrently, with outputs logged separately in the terminal.
